New Records: Shadab Khan's 4-26 were the best figures in a T20 World Cup semi-final to date.
Mohammed Rizwan became the first player ever to score in excess of 1,000 runs in T20 international cricket in a calendar year.
Key Match Events: Matthew Wade hit three consecutive sixes off Shaheen Afridi to secure Australia's win.
Wade and Marcus Stoinis shared an 81-run partnership in less than seven overs.
Shadab Khan took 4 wickets for 26 runs, including key dismissals of Marsh, Smith, Maxwell, and Warner.
Mohammed Rizwan scored 67 off 52 balls despite a chest infection and a facial injury.
Fakhar Zaman scored 55 not out off 32 balls, including two sixes in the last over.
Pre-Game Insights: Matthew Hayden, Pakistan’s batting consultant, had warned that Fakhar Zaman was finding his range.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Dubai International Stadium.
The wicket was noted for its placid nature despite heavy use over the past two months.
